result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be transferred to Winnebago County.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Mental Health or Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with victim or her residence.
Sex Offender Treatment.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence 1/20/2017 at 6:00 p.m..  May be transferred to any other county as long as work release is allowed.  Last 15 days STAYED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Albright

records.addlTxt: Received today, from the Defendant, requesting stay of jail sentence to attend a funeral.
Documents filed by Atty. Reddin
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James A Albright in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1. Court defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Victim makes statements. Atty. Reddin makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

9 months without Huber (Credit - 0 days).  

Term of Probation: 18 months, may be transferred to Winnebago County

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

No contact with victim or her residence.
	
Mental Health or Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Sex Offender Treatment

Condition Time: 60 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence 1/20/2017 at 6:00 pm. May be transferred to any other county as long as work release is allowed. Last 15 days STAYED

COSTS:  $ 243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 11, 2017 at 04:00 pm.
